title: Blended Educational Design for Evidence-Based Practice Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical/public health theory and understanding of research methodologies
context.additional_context: Conducted in an integrated environment combining online materials and face-to-face sessions, presupposing students' use of personal digital devices. Critical thinking training using real-world media cases is emphasized.

learning_goals: Learners can apply a systematic framework to evaluate health-related media claims based on scientific evidence.
Learners can execute the core steps of evidence-based practice (EBP) with over 80% accuracy through group collaborative learning.
Learners can complete at least three practical projects by integrating EBP principles into real-world clinical scenarios.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
